Name: Admiral
Possible Substitution: U.K. Challenger, U.K. Northdown, U.K. Target
Flavor Description: Known for its bittering potential.

Name: Apollo
Flavor Description: A high alpha acid varietal known for its disease resistance.

Name: Boadicea
Flavor Description: spicy

Name: Bobeck
Flavor Description: U.K. Fuggle

Name: Bramling Cross
Possible Substitution: U.K. Kent Golding, U.K. Progress, Whitbread Golding Variety
Flavor Description: Quite mild, fruity currant aroma.

Name: Brewer’s Gold
Flavor Description: Bittering hop with neutral aroma character.

Name: Bullion
Flavor Description: A rich hop primarily used for bittering. Intense blackcurrant aroma.

Name: Cascade
Flavor Description: Pleasant, flowery, spicy, and citrusy. Can have a grapefruit flavor.

Name: Cascade
Flavor Description: Similar to US Cascade, has floral, citrus grapefruit character.

Name: Centennial
Flavor Description: Medium with floral and citrus tones.

Name: Challenger
Possible Substitution: Northern Brewer, U.S. or German Perle
Flavor Description: Mild to moderate, quite spicy.

Name: Chinook
Possible Substitution: Columbus, Northern Brewer, Nugget, U.K. Target
Flavor Description: Mild to medium-heavy, spicy, piney, and grapefruity.

Name: Cluster
Flavor Description: Medium and quite spicy.

Name: Columbus
Possible Substitution: Chinook, Northern Brewer, Nugget, U.K. Target
Flavor Description: Pleasant, with pungent aroma.

Name: El Dorado
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop with fruity, tropical flavors.

Name: First Gold
Flavor Description: A little like Golding family; spicy.

Name: Fuggle
Flavor Description: Mild, pleasant, hoppy, and robust.

Name: Fuggle
Possible Substitution: Styrian Golding, U.K. Fuggle, U.S. Tettnanger, Willamette
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, earthy and fruity.

Name: Galena
Flavor Description: Medium but pleasant hoppiness, citrusy.

Name: Golding
Possible Substitution: U.K. Golding, U.K. Progress, Whitbread Golding Variety
Flavor Description: Mild, extremely pleasant, and gently hoppy.

Name: Horizon
Flavor Description: Spicy, floral. Low co-humulone results in clean tasting beer.

Name: Kent Golding
Possible Substitution: U.K. Progress, U.S. Golding, Whitbread Golding Variety
Flavor Description: Gentle, fragrant, and pleasant.

Name: Magnum
Flavor Description: Known for bittering value and quality.

Name: Magnum
Flavor Description: High alpha variety

Name: Newport
Flavor Description: Fairly pungent.

Name: Northdown
Flavor Description: Fruity with some spiciness.

Name: Northern Brewer
Flavor Description: Medium-strong with some wild tones.

Name: Northern Brewer
Flavor Description: Medium-strong with some wild tones.

Name: Northwest Golding
Flavor Description: Known for aromatic properties.

Name: Nugget
Flavor Description: Quite heavy and herbal.

Name: Olympic
Flavor Description: Mild to medium, citrusy aroma, spicy.

Name: Pacific Gem
Flavor Description: Bittering hop with delicate blackberry and floral oak. Pleasant aroma and high bitterness level.

Name: Pacific Jade
Flavor Description: A “soft” bittering hop with spicy and citrus aroma qualities.

Name: Palisade®
Flavor Description: Some “American” characteristics.

Name: Perle
Flavor Description: Moderately intense, good and hoppy, fruity and a little spicy.

Name: Perle
Flavor Description: Known for its aromatic and bittering properties, pleasant and slightly spicy.

Name: Phoenix
Possible Substitution: U.K. Challenger, U.K. Kent Golding, U.K. Northdown
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop with aromas of pine, chocolate, molasses, and floral.

Name: Pilgrim
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop with citrusy, fruity, spicy, and lemon aromas.

Name: Pioneer
Flavor Description: A mild, typical English aroma.

Name: Pride of Ringwood
Flavor Description: Quite pronounced, woody, earthy, herbal.

Name: Progress
Flavor Description: Moderately strong, good aroma.

Name: Satus
Flavor Description: Known for its bittering and aromatic properties.

Name: Simcoe®
Flavor Description: A bittering and aromatic hop.

Name: Southern Cross
Flavor Description: Piney, resinous bittering hop

Name: Sovereign
Flavor Description: mild flavor

Name: Summit™
Flavor Description: Ultra high-alpha bittering hop

Name: Sun
Flavor Description: High-alpha hop with intense character

Name: Super Alpha
Flavor Description: Earthy, piney bittering hop.

Name: Target
Flavor Description: Pleasant English hop aroma, quite intense.

Name: Tomahawk®
Flavor Description: Primarily a bittering hop.

Name: Warrior®
Flavor Description: A bittering and aromatic hop.

Name: WGV (Whitbread Golding Variety)
Possible Substitution: Glacier, Styrian Golding, U.K. Kent Golding, U.K. Progress, U.K. Target
Flavor Description: Quite pleasant and hoppy, moderately intense, slightly spicy.

Name: Willamette
Possible Substitution: Styrian Golding, U.S. Fuggle, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, fruity, floral, a little earthy.

Name: Yakima Cluster
Flavor Description: Used as a kettle hop for bittering.

Name: Zeus
Flavor Description: Aromatic and pleasant.

Name: Brewer’s Gold
Flavor Description: Black currant, fruity, spicy.

Name: Cascade
Flavor Description: Different than US grown Cascades with more of a spicy flavor and lemony aroma.

Name: Celeia
Flavor Description: Moderate and pleasant zesty bitterness with matching floral aroma, making its use widespread in both ale and lager brewing.

Name: Glacier
Possible Substitution: Styrian Golding, U.S. Fuggle, U.S. Tettnanger, Willamette
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop with a citrus earthy aroma.

Name: Herald
Flavor Description: New dual-purpose hop

Name: Nelson Sauvin
Flavor Description: Distinctive white wine “fruitiness,” gooseberry. Considered by some as “extreme,” this hop is often used in specialty craft and seasonal beers.

Name: Opal
Flavor Description: German dual-purpose hop

Name: Styrian Aurora
Possible Substitution: Northern Brewer, Styrian Golding, U.S. Styrian Bobek
Flavor Description: Intense, pleasant and hoppy. Very suitable for extraction and for combination with other varieties in the brewing process.

Name: Styrian Bobek
Possible Substitution: Styrian Golding, U.K. Fuggle, U.S. Fuggle, Willamette
Flavor Description: Intense, pleasant hop aroma. Similar to Fuggle type.

Name: Styrian Celeia
Flavor Description: Pleasant, hoppy. A high-quality aroma variety with excellent bitterness and aroma qualities.

Name: Styrian Golding
Flavor Description: Delicate, slightly spicy.

Name: Super Pride
Flavor Description: A high alpha variety bred from Pride of Ringwood.

Name: Wakatu
Flavor Description: Wakatu features floral aromas, as well as notes of fresh lime zest, citrus oils, and has a Mittlefrüh-style sweetness.

Name: Ahtanum™
Flavor Description: Floral, citrus, sharp, and piney.

Name: Amarillo®
Flavor Description: Citrusy, flowery.

Name: Azacca®
Flavor Description: A dual-use, high-alpha hop. Aroma and flavor characteristics of apricot, ripe mango, orchard fruit, orange, grapefruit, pine, and pineapple.

Name: Bravo
Flavor Description: Apollo, Zeus

Name: Calypso
Flavor Description: Exhibits pleasant fruity notes-apple, pear, fruit punch.

Name: Cashmere
Flavor Description: This dual purpose variety is an offspring of Cascade and Northern Brewer. Cashmere has aroma and flavor characteristics of melon, lemon, lime, herbs, and citrus fruits.

Name: Citra®
Flavor Description: Intense citrusy flavor.

Name: Comet
Flavor Description: Grapefruit, lemon, orange, and grassy notes.

Name: Eureka!
Flavor Description: An offspring of Apollo and German Merkur, Eureka! has aromas and characteristics of strong herbal notes, pine, mint, grapefruit rind, tangerine, and other citrus. Great for brewers looking for varieties to use in late addition, whirlpool, or “hop stand” hop additions.

Name: Hallertau Blanc
Flavor Description: Winey, passion fruit, grapefruit, gooseberry, pineapple character.

Name: Huell Melon
Flavor Description: Honeydew melon and strawberry aroma.

Name: Idaho
Flavor Description: A dual-purpose variety with flavors and aromas of tropical fruit, orange, apricot, black tea, pine, and herbs.

Name: Lemondrop
Flavor Description: This aroma hop originated from a cross between Cascade and USDA 19058 male. It features (of course) lemony, floral, earthy, herbal, grassy, citrus, pepper, and pine notes.

Name: Mosaic™
Flavor Description: Both fruity and containing grassy, floral, earthy notes.

Name: Orbit
Flavor Description: Orbit is different each year as it uses a proprietary blend of hops specially selected out of the New Zealand “Hops with a Difference” breeding program.

Name: Rakau
Flavor Description: High alpha acids and oil content (particularly myrcene) with low cohumulone, making it ideal for the “hoppy not bitter” school of new world IPAs. Aromas and flavors of ripe fruit, grassiness, lemon, grapefruit juice, and hints of tropical flowers.

Name: Riwaka
Flavor Description: Citrusy, grapefruit aroma hop

Name: Sorachi Ace
Flavor Description: Bittering hop with lemony aroma

Name: Summer
Flavor Description: A hop variety formerly known as Summer Saaz that has a gentle floral aroma, slightly earthy. Expect apricot and stone fruit notes when used in dry hopping.

Name: Wai-iti
Flavor Description: Aroma hop with a startlingly citrus aroma made up of mandarin, lemon and lime zest

Name: Waimea
Flavor Description: High alpha but also lots of oils giving fresh tangelo and citrus fruit aroma with pine needles

Name: Belma
Flavor Description: Clean bitterness, citrus, tropical fruit flavors.

Name: Eroica
Flavor Description: Strong but pleasant aroma.

Name: Green Bullet
Possible Substitution: Crystal, Hallertauer Tradition, Liberty, Mt. Hood, Ultra
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop.

Name: Hallertau Aroma
Flavor Description: A dual purpose hop which has been used to replace Perle

Name: Hallertauer
Flavor Description: Very mild, pleasant, and slightly flowery, some spicy.

Name: Hallertauer Gold
Flavor Description: Known for its aromatic properties similar to Hallertauer.

Name: Hallertauer Mittelfrüh
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant.

Name: Hallertauer Tradition
Flavor Description: Known for its aromatic properties. A replacement for Hallertauer Mittelfrüh.

Name: Hersbrucker
Flavor Description: Mild to semi-strong, pleasant, hoppy.

Name: Liberty
Flavor Description: Mild and clean aroma, slightly spicy character.

Name: Mt. Hood
Flavor Description: Mild, pleasant, and clean, somewhat pungent and resiny.

Name: Pacifica
Flavor Description: An aroma hop with some citrus and floral character

Name: Pekko™
Flavor Description: A clean and pleasant variety with floral mint, herbal, citrus, thyme, cucumber, lemon, and sage characteristics. Sometimes described as “Saaz like.”

Name: Polaris
Flavor Description: Minty, icy quality.

Name: Saaz
Flavor Description: Very mild with pleasant hoppy notes, earthy, spicy, and herbal.

Name: Saaz
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, earthy and spicy.

Name: Santiam
Possible Substitution: German Spalt, German Spalt Select, German Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Noble characteristics.

Name: Saphir
Flavor Description: Mild aroma hop.

Name: Sladek
Possible Substitution: Czech Saaz, U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: A dual-purpose Saaz hybrid.

Name: Spalt
Possible Substitution: German Spalt Select, U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy.

Name: Spalt Select
Possible Substitution: German Spalt, U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Very fine Spalter-type aroma.

Name: Spalt Select
Flavor Description: Medium intensity and pleasant hoppy qualities. Medium-strong aroma with wild American tones.

Name: Sterling
Flavor Description: Herbal, spicy, pleasant aroma, hint of floral and citrus.

Name: Strisslespalt
Flavor Description: Medium intensity, pleasant, hoppy.

Name: Taurus
Flavor Description: high-alpha hop

Name: Tettnanger
Possible Substitution: German Spalt, German Spalt Select, Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, herbal.

Name: Tettnanger
Flavor Description: An aromatic hop, mild and slightly spicy.

Name: Tradition
Flavor Description: Very fine and similar to Hallertauer Mittelfrüh.

Name: Ultra
Flavor Description: Very good to outstanding, some Saaz-like qualities. Aromatic properties similar to Hallertauer.

Name: Vanguard
Flavor Description: Aroma similar to continental European types.

Name: Legacy
Flavor Description: Clean grapefruit, floral, black currant notes and a spicy aroma.

Name: Crystal
Possible Substitution: French Strisslespalt, Hallertauer, Hersbrucker, Liberty, Mt. Hood
Flavor Description: Mild and pleasant, spicy and flowery.

Name: Ella
Flavor Description: Dual purpose hop that displays floral and subtle spice notes. When used as a late addition or dry hop, it imparts grapefruit and topical flavors.

Name: Herkules
Flavor Description: bittering hop

Name: Merkur
Flavor Description: high-alpha, bittering hop

Name: Millenium
Flavor Description: Mild, herbal, similar to Nugget.

Name: Mt. Rainier
Flavor Description: only available in 2012

Name: Motueka
Flavor Description: Aroma hop that is fruity, tropical and citrusy.

Name: Select
Flavor Description: noble-type aroma

Name: Aurora
Flavor Description: Northern Brewer

Name: Smaragd
Flavor Description: Fruity and floral aromas.

Name: Jarrylo™
Flavor Description: A high-alpha hop, the flavor imparts a mild sweetness and a tea-like spice, with flavors and aromas of banana, pear, spice, and herbal notes.

Name: Mandarina Bavaria
Flavor Description: Mandarin orangey flavor and aroma.

Name: Galaxy™
Flavor Description: When used as a late addition or dry hopped, it contributes a pungent flavor of passionfruit and citrus.

Name: Kohatu
Flavor Description: Aroma hop with high essential oils and intense floral characters of pine needles and tropical fruit.

Name: Topaz
Flavor Description: A dual purpose hop, Topaz adds a resinous, grassy flavors; however, with later additions and in higher gravity brews, light tropical fruit flavors (some say lychee) become more pronounced.

Name: Vic Secret
Flavor Description: An aroma hop with resinous, grassy and mild fruit flavors. Late and dry hop additions introduce appealing clean and distinct pineapple and pine characters. Lighter and less dominant than Galaxy.

Name: Marynka
Flavor Description: New hop variety with intense aroma

Name: Lublin
Possible Substitution: Czech Saaz, U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
Flavor Description: Mild and typical of noble aroma types, spicy, herbal.

Name: Premiant
Flavor Description: A dual purpose variety with a balanced bitterness and slightly spicy aroma
